data.name: How far away is it ?
data.description:
The idea is to calculate the distance between two cities (or more
pragmatically, between any two given points on the earth). For this matter,
the earth will be considered as a perfect sphere (R=6371km), the result is
expected in kilometers, with a precision rounded to the meter.

Wite a class City which will accept a couple of coordinates, and provide a
method haversine_distance to compute the distance to another City.

```python
class City(object):
    def __init__(self, latitude, longitude):
        pass

    def haversine_distance(self, city):
        pass
```

Could it be of any help, the class Coordinates is provided as an helper, which will accept human
written coordinates and return degrees (or radians) for your benefit. If you wish you had coded it, do not hesitate to pass by this other kata: [Multi Poly Coordinate](https://www.codewars.com/kata/multi-poly-coordinates)

```python
$ paris_lat = Coordinates('N', 48, 51, 52.9776)
$ paris_lat.degrees
48.864716
$ paris_lat.radians
0.85285018
```

The City constructor can accept either tuples or Coordinates instances, i.e.:

```City((('N', 48, 51, 52.9776), ('W', 2, 20, 56.4504)))``` and
```City(Coordinates('N', 48, 51, 52.9776), 
        Coordinates('W', 2, 20, 56.4504))```
are equivalent.

As a final word, an example:

```python
$ paris = City(('N', 48, 51, 52.9776), ('W', 2, 20, 56.4504))
$ new_york = City(('N', 40, 42, 51), ('E', 74, 0, 21))
$ new_york.haversine_distance(paris)
5836.588
```
